newsitem.title: JAPAN: Activist from HK protest boat dead - Japan official.
newsitem.headline: Activist from HK protest boat dead - Japan official.

text.p: An activist from a Hong Kong vessel protesting Japan's claim to disputed islands in the East China Sea died on Thursday, despite efforts to resuscitate him, Japanese maritime officials said.
"A doctor from Japan who boarded the Hong Kong ship confirmed that Chan Yuk Cheung David was dead," a spokesman for Japan's Maritime Safety Agency told Reuters.

Chan and three other men jumped off the Hong Kong vessel, Kien Hwa 2, earlier in the day. One of the men, Fong Yu Yuen, was taken to hospital in the southern Japan prefecture of Okinawa. The two others were rescued uninjured.
The chartered vessel from Hong Kong had set sail on Sunday for the disputed East China Sea islands, which are claimed by Japan, Taiwan and China.

The activists had vowed to reclaim the islands, known as the Senkakus in Japan and Diaoyus in Chinese, saying they would remove a lighthouse built by Japanese rightists in July and raise the red flag of the People's Republic of China.
